seo.h1_title: New Zealand Nature Tour: Glaciers, Fiords and Volcanic Landscapes
seo.intro_paragraph: Begin at Piha and its black sand, then explore Tongariro and its volcanic landscapes. Paddle through Abel Tasman coves, then cross toward the glaciers and descend to Fiordland. The Catlins close the march, between wild shores and raw nature. A New Zealand playing on contrasts, from fire to fjord.
seo.seo_hook: Black sand facing crashing waves, volcanoes smoking under blue sky, glaciers crossing rainforest. New Zealand overwhelms at every horizon.

seo.h1_title: New Zealand in Two Weeks: North and South Island Volcanoes to Fjords
seo.intro_paragraph: Relax in Rotorua's hot springs, then explore Coromandel's bays and hidden corners. Then reach glacier country, follow Lake Tekapo's blue and reach Mount Cook. End at Queenstown, where adventure blends with summit and lake panoramas. An itinerary moving from steam to open air.
seo.seo_hook: Hot springs steaming in fern forests, turquoise lakes reflecting snow-capped peaks, fjords carving primordial rock. Two weeks barely scratch the surface.

seo.h1_title: New Zealand's Grand Circuit: North & South Island in 3 Weeks
seo.intro_paragraph: Follow Rotorua and its geysers, then trace the East Cape coast where ocean strikes rock. Cross Cook Strait to the South Island, head to Abel Tasman and its golden beaches, then approach Milford Sound and its dizzying cliffs. New Zealand strings together scenes, each road offering a new idea of adventure.
seo.seo_hook: Geysers hissing in thermal mist, glaciers calving into turquoise lakes, fjords cutting through ancient rock. New Zealand, a continent in miniature.
